definition: abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)

sentences.english: I recommend the Quanjude Peking Roast Duck.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐全聚德的北京烤鸭。

sentences.english: I went to eat BeiJin duck with my colleague.
sentences.chinese: 我今晚跟同事一起去吃北京烤鸭。

sentences.english: We have roast Peking duck, "Ma por"bean curd, and braised sea cucumber with minced meat.
sentences.chinese: 我们有北京烤鸭，麻婆豆腐和肉末烧海参。

sentences.english: The roast Beijing duck is delicious. Its skin is really crispy.
sentences.chinese: 北京烤鸭味道极好，烤鸭皮又脆又香。

sentences.english: You have to taste Beijing Roast Duck.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要品尝一下北京烤鸭。

sentences.english: The roast Peking duck exuded a delicious aroma.
sentences.chinese: 北京烤鸭散发出一股诱人的香味。

sentences.english: Such a handsome profit ought to be a cue to crack open the champagne and roast some Beijing duck.
sentences.chinese: 获得如此高的利润理应喝香槟，吃北京烤鸭庆祝。

sentences.english: I’d like Beijing Roast Duck and some vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我要北京烤鸭和一些蔬菜。

sentences.english: Outside Peking duck, thefood in the north is awful.
sentences.chinese: 北京烤鸭，这道北方菜真是太糟了，味道又淡又油腻。

sentences.english: Beijing Roasted Duck is always served in well-cut slices.
sentences.chinese: 北京烤鸭一直都是切薄片吃的。

sentences.english: Mei: Try some of this, Bill. It's the regional specialty, Peking Duck.
sentences.chinese: 比尔，尝尝这个，这是地方风味，北京烤鸭。

sentences.english: Beijing cuisine is especially well-known for the roast duck.
sentences.chinese: 京帮菜尤以北京烤鸭著称。

sentences.english: The famous specialities of these two are roast suckling pig and roast Beijing duck.
sentences.chinese: 这两种菜系的著名特色菜分别是烤乳猪和北京烤鸭。

sentences.english: The Peking Roast Duck is delicious.
sentences.chinese: 北京烤鸭以皮脆肉嫩而得以闻名。

sentences.english: Hot pot, Beijing roast duck, tomatoes on sticks Peking noodles, and so on…
sentences.chinese: 火锅，北京烤鸭，糖葫芦，炸酱面等等。

definition: shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒賣|烧卖[shao1 mai4]
lit. meat wedged in steamed bun/"Chinese burger"/sliced meat sandwich popular in north China
Cantonese poached chicken, known as "white cut chicken"
stinky tofu/strong-smelling preserved beancurd/fig. rough exterior but lovable person
erhua variant of 爆肚[bao4 du3]
shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒麥|烧麦[shao1 mai4]
